item.title: How to Install Linux
item.description: Guide to Installing Linux (for beginners) Introduction Hello, this guide is for Linux beginners who are looking to try Linux out don’t know where to start. Below is a table of contents that outlines all the things we will be covering in this guide. Table of Contents - So what is Linux anyways? - What is a Desktop Environment? - Choosing a Distribution - So how do I install Linux? - How to install programs?

item.title: Second
item.description: Front Matter Hugo allows you to add front matter in yaml, toml, or json to your content files. Front matter allows you to keep metadata attached to an instance of a content type—i.e., embedded inside a content file—and is one of the many features that gives Hugo its strength. Front Matter Formats Hugo supports four formats for front matter, each with their own identifying tokens. TOML identified by opening and closing +++.
